text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Hearing-impaired infant" means an infant who has an impairment that is a dysfunction of the auditory system of any type or degree which is sufficient to interfere with the acquisition and development of speech and language skills with or without the use of sound amplification.
"Infant" means a child who is under the age of 1 year.
"Newborn" means a child up to 29 days old who is born in or receives care in a hospital in the State.

"Program" means the program that the Secretary establishes to provide for the universal hearing screening of newborns and early identification and follow-up of hearing-impaired infants and infants who have a risk factor of developing a hearing impairment.
